result.execSummary:
Kevin A Caduff was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Kevin A Caduff was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A Caduff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Kevin A Caduff, in custody, appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(1:48)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
15CF173 - pleading to Ct 1 & 5 - remaining counts dismissed & 15TR3459, 15TR3460, 15TR3461
Deft - 15CF173 Ct 1 - pleads no contest)  waives rights & JT
          15CF173 Ct 5 - pleads no contest)  waives rights & JT
Schlough - deft making plea voluntarily
State - waive extradition in 15CF172 & defaulted on 15CV158 - 3 yrs IC 4 yrs ES, cc, waive PSI set sentencing for later date to be extradited to MN - State is agreeing to concurrent sentence if deft has prison sent in MN
Deft agrees to appear via telephone for sentencing

COURT:  15CF173 Ct 1 & 5 pleas voluntary - finds deft guilty of both  (both as repeater)
15CV158 - signs order forfeiting monies as presented to Court
15CF172 - deft signs waiver of extradition - Court signs extradition warrant - cash bond remains held - allows MN to pick up deft
***SENTENCING HEARING SET ON 15CF173 ON NOVEMBER 10, 2015 AT 4:00 P.M. W/15 MIN. ALLOTTED (NEEDS ADDED TO CASE 15CF173)***

DISMISS:  15CF173 Ct 2, 3, 4, 6, 15TR3459, 15TR3460, 15TR3461

Defendant, Kevin A Caduff, in custody, appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(4:18)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
Schlough - believe they are on same page - can set for plea
Deft - has court in MN - once he gets there they have to have him in court w/n 48 hrs
Schlough - we would plea and set sentencing at later date
Deft - agrees to do sentencing telephonically if capable

COURT:  bonds continue
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant, Kevin A Caduff, in custody, appeared with Attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(8:54)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
15CF173 - argn - waive reading - pleads not guilty & to TR's 
Schlough - request status

COURT:  deft needs to provide photo's and prints
15CF172 tagalong
  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 04:15 pm.

11:05 am Defendant, Kevin A Caduff in custody with Attorney Scott S. Schlough appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf.   Vickie Girard - Clerk
Multiple cases heard. Prelim in 15CF173 only.
State calls Deputy Chad Pollock.  Sworn & testifies.
Witness identifies defendant.
11:13 Atty Schlough to cross.
11:16 Witness excuesed.
No further witnesses.

Court: Finds probable cause & is bound over for trial. Give date for arraignment. Bond continues.
  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:45 am.
